europeana:record.dc:title: A case of associated occurrence of the crab Lauridromia inter-media (Laurie, 1906) (Crustacea: Decapoda: Dromiidae) and the actinian Nemanthus annamensis Carlgren, 1943 (Anthozoa: Actiniaria: Nemanthidae)
Zoologische Mededelingen
europeana:record.dc:creator: Lavaleye M.S.S.
Hartog, den J.C.
europeana:record.dc:subject: Arthropoda
Crustacea Decapoda Dromiidae; Lauridromia intermedia; Actiniaria Nemanthidae; Nemanthus annamensis; association; first record; Kenya; review
europeana:record.dc:description: Members of the crab family Dromiidae tend to cover their carapace mostly with sponges or colonial tunicates. More rarely are used other objects or organisms such as solitary Tunicata, Zoantharia (= encrusting anemones), valves of Bivalvia, etc.; a review of these is presented. A new association of a dromiid crab Lauridromia intermedia (Laurie, 1906) and an actinian Nemanthus annamensis Carlgren, 1943, is described and discussed. Lauridromia intermedia is recorded for the first time from the continental shelf of East Africa.
europeana:record.dcterms:isPartOf: A case of associated occurrence of the crab Lauridromia inter-media (Laurie, 1906) (Crustacea: Decapoda: Dromiidae) and the actinian Nemanthus annamensis Carlgren, 1943 (Anthozoa: Actiniaria: Nemanthidae) (URN:ISSN:0024-0672) (Volume 69) (Issue 11)
